com.storageroomapp.client

Class Collection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.storageroomapp.client.Collection

  • public class Collection
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the Collection concept in StorageRoom.

    The usual way of obtaining a reference to a Collection is from a Collections object (which in turn is retrieved from an Application object).

    In the rare case that you want to create a new collection via the API, there is a public constructor that you need to use.

    If you need to inspect the metadata of the fields on this Collection, consult the Fields child object.

    GET: If you need a way to query for the entries in this Collection, see the CollectionEntries child object.

    CREATE: To add a new Entry to this Collection, see the insert operation on the child CollectionEntries object.

    UPDATE, DELETE: look for the respective methods on the Entry object to update or delete individual entries

    • Constructor Detail

      • Collection

        public Collection(Application parent,
          java.lang.String name,
          java.lang.String entryType)
        Creates a new Collection object for the account.

        Note, this method is only used if you are intending to create a new collection in your StorageRoom account. Otherwise, the framework will create the Collection objects for you (see Collections).

        Parameters:
        parent - the parent Application/Account for which this collection is associated
        name - the String name of the collection as seen in the SR UI
        entryType - the String entry type as seen in the SR UI

    • Method Detail

      • parseJson

        public static Collection parseJson(Application parent,
                   java.lang.String json)
        Parses a String of json text and returns an Collection object. It will correctly parse the Collection object if it is toplevel, or also if nested in an 'collection' key-value pair.
        Parameters:
        json - the String with the json text
        Returns:
        an Collection object, or null if the parsing failed

      • parseJsonObject

        public static Collection parseJsonObject(Application parent,
                         org.json.simple.JSONObject jsonObj)
        Unmarshalls an Collection object from a JSONObject. This method assumes the name-values are immediately attached to the passed object and not nested under a key (e.g. 'collection')
        Parameters:
        jsonObj - the JSONObject
        Returns:
        an Collection object, or null if the unpacking failed

      • getFields

        public Fields getFields()
        Returns a live copy of the child Fields object. When creating or updating a collection, you may directly modify the returned object.
        Returns:
        the Fields object, which will never be null

      • getEntries

        public CollectionEntries getEntries()
        Returns a live copy of the child Entry objects.
        Returns:
        the CollectionEntries object, which will never be null

      • create

        public boolean create()
        Creates a new Collection on the server for this Application/Account. Be sure to populate the Fields child object.

        This operation will only succeed if this Collection was created via the public constructor.

        Returns:
        true if the Collection was created on the server, false if not

      • update

        public boolean update(Fields fields)
        Updates the Collection definition on the server for this Application/Account.

        This operation will only succeed if this Collection was retrieved via the API (parsed JSON).

        Returns:
        true if the Collection was created on the server, false if not

      • emptyTrash

        public boolean emptyTrash()
        Note, emptying the trash does not currently work. StorageRoom is aware of the issue: http://help.storageroomapp.com/discussions/questions/977-api-to-empty-the-trash
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if not
